title: Client-side webpart manifest
description: A client-side webpart is a drop-in control that is part of the end user page authoring experience.

oneOf.title: Text, media, and content
oneOf.description: This group includes web parts that display text, multi-media, documents, information from the web, and other rich content.

oneOf.title: Discovery
oneOf.description: This group includes web parts that organize, group, and filter content to help users discover information.

oneOf.title: Communication and collaboration
oneOf.description: This group includes web parts that facilitate information sharing, team work, and social interactions.

oneOf.title: Planning and process
oneOf.description: This group includes web parts that empower team productivity with the use of planning and process tools.

oneOf.title: Business and intelligence
oneOf.description: This group includes web parts for tracking and analyzing data, and for integrating business flow with pages.

oneOf.title: Site tools
oneOf.description: This group includes web parts for site information and management.

oneOf.title: Other
oneOf.description: This group includes web parts not in other categories.

canUpdateConfiguration.title: Can Update Configuration
canUpdateConfiguration.description: If set to "true", this web part uses the property pane to update the configuration of a web part.

disabledOnClassicSharepoint.title: Disabled On Classic Sharepoint
disabledOnClassicSharepoint.description: If set to "true", this web part is disabled on Classic Sharepoint pages.

experimentalData.title: Experimental property bag
experimentalData.description: Only use for properties not ready for production.

hiddenFromToolbox.title: Hidden from the modern SharePoint toolbox
hiddenFromToolbox.description: If set to "true", this web part will not be visible on the modern SharePoint toolbox.

supportsFullBleed.title: Supports full bleed display experience
supportsFullBleed.description: If set to "true", this web part supports and has been tested for full bleed experience.

isolationLevel.title: Isolation Level
isolationLevel.description: Describes the level of isolation ("None", "DOMIsolation") needed for the "WebPart".

supportsThemeVariants.title: Supports theme variants experience
supportsThemeVariants.description: If set to "true", this web part supports and has been tested for the theme variants experience.

useFallbackWhenPropertiesUpdatedExternal.title: Use fallback when properties updated externally
useFallbackWhenPropertiesUpdatedExternal.description: If true, the web part will be disposed and reloaded when the web part data is updated by an external source. If false, the web part data will be deserialized and the properties of the web part will be updated, onAfterPropertiesUpdatedExternally will be executed. If undefined, web parts developed with SPFx version below 1.9 will default to true and web parts developed with a SPFx version 1.9 or greater will default to false.

supportedHosts.description: An array indicates the web part supports any of following hosts. If this property is missing the default is SharePointFullPage

searchablePropertyNames.title: Searchable Property Names
searchablePropertyNames.description: List of names of Web Part properties that need to be indexed for search.

linkPropertyNames.title: Link Property Names
linkPropertyNames.description: List of names of Web Part properties that are links and need to be link fixed up. Link fixup is a SharePoint feature to help make sure SharePoint internal links in the content are correct. Pages and content can be moved around within SharePoint site hierarchy.

imageLinkPropertyNames.title: Image Link Property Names
imageLinkPropertyNames.description: List of names of Web Part properties that are image sources and need to be link fixed up and potentially preloaded for performance reasons.

requiredCapabilities.title: Required Capabilities
requiredCapabilities.description: The set of capabilities this web part requires from the host page in order to be usable. If the host does not support one of the required capabilities, the web part will not be visible in the toolbox.

BingMapsKey.description: A boolean flag indicates if the web part requires the Bing maps key to be available in the site. The Bing maps credential key can be used to show the Bing maps control according to a provided coordinate.

AuthenticationModel.description: An array indicates the web part requires any of following authentication models to be available in the site. The authentication model can be used to connect to Microsoft Graph, O365 connecter, etc.

preconfiguredEntries.title: Pre-configured Entries
preconfiguredEntries.description: A Web Part can have pre-configured properties like the title, description, toolbox group name and Web Part specific custom properties.

items.description: This interface specifies the set of properties that can be pre-configured by a Web Part developer. Each pre-configured instance of the Web Part will need a copy of these properties. Organization admins and content authors can modify these properties on a need basis.

title.title: Title
title.description: Title of the web part represented as a single a dictionary of locale keys to title values. This value will be displayed to the user in the toolbox. A dictionary must contain a "default" key. This title should be used in the Toolbox and other display areas. The Web Part developer may give an initial title to the webpart. The organization admin and page author will have the ability to change this title as per need.

description.title: Description
description.description: Description of the web part represented as a dictionary of locale keys to description values. This value will be displayed to the user in the toolbox. A dictionary must contain a 'default' key. This description should be used in the Toolbox tooltip and other display areas. The Web Part developer may give an initial description to the webpart. The organization admin and page author will have the ability to change this description as per need.

officeFabricIconFontName.title: Office Fabric Icon Name
officeFabricIconFontName.description: The icon for the Web Part, to be displayed in the toolbox, represented as a character name in the Office 365 icon font file. The icon font is specified here: http://o365icons.cloudapp.net/. If this field has a value, the 'iconImageUrl' field will be ignored.

iconImageUrl.title: Icon Image URL
iconImageUrl.description: The icon for the WebPart, to be displayed in the toolbox, represented an image URL. The image at the URL must be exactly 38x38 px. If the 'officeFabricIconName' field does not have a value, this field must have a value.

groupId.title: Group ID
groupId.description: The group id to determine which modern group contains the web part in modern site page. The SharePoint Framework reserves group ids for predefined groups. The developer can pick one from those groups. If the developer fills an id not in the predefined groups, it falls back to Other group.

anyOf.description: If the group ID is not from the predefined group list, the web part will go to Other group.

group.title: Group
group.description: The group name in web part picker to contain the web part in the classic page. If no value is provided, then the web part will be displayed in the Miscellaneous group.

tags.title: Tags
tags.description: This field is used to tag a web part with keywords that are different from the web part group name. Tags can be used for categorization and searching of web parts. For example, in the web part toolbox.

properties.title: Properties
properties.description: every Web Part is expected to have some custom properties. e.g. an image Web Part may have the image url and caption text as custom properties, a list Web Part may have the list id and list title as custom properties, and so on.
